title: Show HN: Realtime Weather Data for InfluxDB
text:
Hi HN! I made a tiny app to write real-time weather data into an InfluxDB database. Initially, I made it to test out InfluxDB deployments at work but figured it could be useful to other people too.

The app gives you

- temperature and CO2 data from 10 houses around the world

- generated by a combination of real inputs from a weather API + my own simulation

If you have an InfluxDB lying around, please give it a go!

Ask HN: Full stack for hardware touch screen device
text:
If I wanted to build a relatively simple touch screen device that has some hardware functions (eg turns on and off 3-5 components with 1-5 settings per component, perhaps like an automated espresso machine), what software and firmware stack would you use?

Looking to get started in this space but don’t want to reinvent the ship. Ideally a system that lets you get started quickly and iterate from there.

Tell HN: Microsoft just disabled Exchange sync for all Android phones. EEE?
text: Like the title says, Microsoft just permanently disabled user+pw auth for Exchange, which means all Android phones that use the built-in Exchange ActiveSync client have stopped working. The only remaining way to access your Outlook calendar on Android is now the official Microsoft Outlook app. All 3rd-party apps are locked out because the OS support for the account type is missing. Looks like Embrace + Extend + Extinguish is back in full force.

Self Hosted 3rd Party Authentication Service?
text:
Looks like Okta, Auth0 etc. all require you to send user creds to their servers for authentication.

Wondering if there's an option to self host some of these services so we can keep the data within our system.
